name: Dance Party Magic
description:
description: summer tee
inspired by: sweaty dance parties
color: white
inks: cadmium red & turquoise
Long before they were famous, Matt ROAN and E-Six used to throw insane under-the-radar dance parties at hole-in-the-wall bars like Tuman's and Town Hall Pub. For two, long years their Dance Party Magic events dominated hipster nightlife in Chicago. The only way to capture how awesome these Midwest mash-ups were, was to produce a 3-D design. The best part is every T-shirt comes with a pair of cardboard anaglyph glasses and a limited edition vinyl DPM sticker! ⋅ 100% sheer jersey cotton ⋅ slimmer fit than our classic tee ⋅ pre-laundered for minimal shrinkage ⋅ printed on American Apparel 6401 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Cupcake Heartbreak
description:
description: short sleeve track tee
inspired by: a bitter, biting sense of humor
color: tri-blend black
inks: cyan, magenta, white, grey, black
Blogging by the pseudonym Cupcake Jones, Jona Meyer keeps a quiet (albeit completely caustic) diatribe called Cupcake Heartbreak. The 30-something Chicago librarian caught our eye a few years back with her original blog (JonaHatesYou.com) and continues to crack us up with her Vice-worthy sarcasm and sardonic hyperbole. Follow the modern satirist @cupcakeheartbrk ⋅ Tri-Blend (50% Polyester / 25% Cotton / 25% Rayon) ⋅ form-fitting ⋅ printed on American Apparel TR301 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Believe in Music II
description:
description: classic fitted tee
inspired by: the power of music
color: heather grey
inks: black, white, sunburst yellow
There isn't much more we can add to the sentiments expressed on this t-shirt. The power of music is shaping intellectual property rights and reinventing the relationship between artists, fans and major labels. 1979 was pretty important too: it marked the demise of disco and the commercial emergence of hip hop. It was also the same year music legends Charles Mingus, Sid Vicious and Donny Hathaway passed away. ⋅ 90% fine jersey cotton / 10% polyester ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 2102 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Body Copy
description:
description: fleece track jacket
inspired by: typographic experiments
colors: black, asphalt or cranberry
inks: white
designer: Will Miller
Vim aeque officiis ne, officiis percipit eu nam. Te oratio munere vim, atqui nostrum signiferumque eos id. Eu eam lorem veritus offendit, quo mazim definitiones in. Pertinax atomorum ne eos, propriae efficiendi nam no. Per invidunt laboramus forensibus ei, his ad justo falli congue. Ut solet patrioque has, sea ad. ⋅ 100% extra soft ring-spun combed cotton ⋅ white nylon zipper, zips to top of collar ⋅ raglan sleeves ⋅ kangaroo pocket ⋅ contrast white piping ⋅ pre-laundered for minimal shrinkage ⋅ thick and warm, yet breathable ⋅ printed on American Apparel 5455 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Shameless Plug II
description:
description: vintage track t-shirt
inspired by: our own logo
color: heather grey
inks: black
When we first started Good Night TV, customers told us our logo was "good enough to be on a shirt all by itself". We blushed, curtsied and took it as a compliment but all the flattery went straight to our tv mascot's head. "Frowny", our sad little set, started ego tripping—demanding a chance at a solo career. So we finally caved and screened a sketchy hand drawn version of him on the softest vintage t-shirt we could find. Feeling a bit sheepish about our blatant self-promotion, we tried to balance it out with a bit of humility on the inside hit. Damn you, Frowny! ⋅ Tri-Blend (50% Polyester / 25% Cotton / 25% Rayon) ⋅ slimmer fit ⋅ printed on American Apparel TR401 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Rubbish II
description:
description: summer tee
inspired by: independent film
color: white
inks: eggshell, metallic gold
Back in 2005 (around the same time we launched Good Night TV) a crew of young Chicago filmmakers formed their own creative collective and set out to make moves (and movies). Our first glimpse into their genius was a little viral video on YouTube. Then it was a student film that earned them a spot at Cannes' short film corner. It wasn't long before the humbly-named Rubbish crew was directing music videos for The Cool Kids, shooting snowboard docs for Flow and winning major awards at international film festivals. Inspired by their unassuming mastery of the medium, the gold Palme d'Or text reads: "legitimate, innovative, cinema" while the subtle off-white text reads: "low-budget, amateur, independent, garbage". ⋅ 100% sheer jersey cotton construction ⋅ form-fitting ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 6301 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Nicofeli Tigers
description:
description: fine jersey short sleeve tee
inspired by: kids in Kibera
color: gold
inks: black & white
During the summer of 2009, Good Night, TV! teamed up with humanitarian, Ron Reason to donate six dozen jerseys to young footballers in the Kenyan slum of Kibera. The young athletes asked for a fiercesome mascot worthy of the Swahili phrase pasipo hofu or "live without fear". Proceeds from the sale of this T-shirt continue efforts to build a permanent library for the Nicofeli Youth Club. ⋅ 100% sheer jersey construction ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 2001 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Rubbish
description:
description: summer tee
inspired by: independent film
color: white
inks: eggshell, metallic gold
Back in 2005 (around the same time we launched Good Night TV) a crew of young Chicago filmmakers formed their own creative collective and set out to make moves (and movies). Our first glimpse into their genius was a little viral video on YouTube. Then it was a student film that earned them a spot at Cannes' short film corner. It wasn't long before the humbly-named Rubbish crew was directing music videos for The Cool Kids, shooting snowboard docs for Flow and winning major awards at international film festivals. Inspired by their unassuming mastery of the medium, the gold Palme d'Or text reads: "legitimate, innovative, cinema" while the subtle off-white text reads: "low-budget, amateur, independent, garbage". ⋅ 100% sheer jersey cotton construction ⋅ fits slimmer than our classic tee ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 6401 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Invader
description:
description: fine jersey v-neck
inspired by: 8-bit alien warfare
colors: ash + white stripe
inks: black
Combining the timeless refinement of the houndstooth check with the analog simplicity of Atari, Invader is the perfect blend of David Jones and David Theurer. Based on the tiny craft from Missle Command and Space Invaders, the classic pattern deconstructs across the shirt in bold, black contrast. A tiny 20 point invader hides on the back. ⋅ 100% fine ring-spun combed cotton ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 2456 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Midwest II
description:
description: classic fitted s/s tee
inspired by: the Midwest
color: creme
inks: navy, orange (Go Bears)
Ever since Ice Cube and Westside Connection started throwin' their "dubs" in the air, clever cats in the Midwest switched up the letterforms and began claiming their own hood. So while Good Night TV didn't invent the gesture, we are the first ones to pay homage to it and commit it to silkscreen. So for all the Midwesterners that have ever twisted up their fingers and formed the M-DUB, this shirt is for you. ⋅ 100% sheer jersey cotton construction ⋅ form-fitting ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 6301 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Meowl
description:
description: classic fitted tee
inspired by: animal identity crises
color: lemon
inks: french grey, creme, white, black
designed by: Kyle Harter
Essentially, Meowl is a species-confused owl who identifies with felines rather than nocturnal birds of prey... in other words, Meowl thinks he's a cat. Don't really get it? Well, neither do we. But we love it! If you really wanna know, ask Kyle (he made it up). ⋅ 100% fine jersey cotton ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 2001 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Invader II
description:
description: sheer deep v-neck
inspired by: 8-bit alien warfare
colors: lapis or asphalt
inks: chartreuse yellow or bleach white
Combining the timeless refinement of the houndstooth check with the analog simplicity of Atari, Invader is the perfect blend of David Jones and David Theurer. Based on the tiny craft from Missle Command and Space Invaders, the classic pattern deconstructs across the shirt in bold, black contrast. A tiny 20 point invader hides on the back. ⋅ 100% sheer jersey construction ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 6456 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Down Sowf
description:
description: classic fitted s/s tee
inspired by: olde-timey slab serifs
color: chocolate
inks: dusty rose, antique white
When Charlie moved up to Chicago, he brought 26 years of Southern hospitality, a penchant for sweet tea and several cases of Dale's. But two things he couldn't import were: Muscadines & Scuppernongs. The bronze and violet fruits are found in jams, jellies and wines all over the Dirty-Dirty. And just like our T-shirt says, they're waaay better than the standard grape. Packed with resveratrol + antioxidants, we bet they'll be the new health craze that bumps the haughty POM® off its high horse. ⋅ 100% fine jersey cotton ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 2001 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free

name: Hamilton
description:
description: jersey leisure shirt
inspired by: that loot
color: olive
inks: french grey
Named for the first guy featured on the double-buck, this fine jersey 4-button leisure shirt features a stylized "$2" shoulder hit illustrated with the flourish of legal tender. But this rare monetary amount is actually quite customary as the pathetic and appalling hourly wage of stateside slave labor. Small type along the left seam reads: "The average hourly wage of an undocumented sweatshop worker in the United States." A steady reminder for when you get all caught up in that two dollar, dollar bill ya'll. ⋅ 100% fine jersey cotton construction ⋅ 4-button placket ⋅ single front pocket ⋅ structured collar holds its shape after repeated washing ⋅ pre-shrunk and laundered ⋅ printed on American Apparel 2412 ⋅ manufactured in the USA and sweatshop-free
